content.description: Climb the mellow corner/crack to a steep finish onto the big ledge. Bolts below the ledge can be used to set up short, beginner topropes. But for full value, continue up the face on the left side of the crack to the top.
content.protection: standard rack, bolted anchors at the very top and below the large ledge
content.location: Starts in a corner/chimney toward the left end of the wall. Look for bolted anchors just below a large ledge about 40 feet up.

content.description: From the slanting boulder pull the roof to a thin face.  Continue to a ledge, the climb the wide crack to the top (5.7).
content.protection: 5 bolts to bolted Anchors before the ledge.  There are also bolts leading to another set of anchors at the top of the cliff.
content.location: 10 feet to the left of a large crack (Vegomatic)

content.description: Similar to Chicken Bone but what can seem like a 5.10- crux.  It's NC so you only get credit for 5.8 climbing.
content.location: Bolted route to the right of Chicken Bone

content.description: A nice top-rope route with tricky face moves and some hard-to-see holds where you need them.  Has the same dramatic bouldery start as Thin to Win, but after that heads roughly straight up instead of veering right.
content.protection: Top-rope can be set on the bolted anchor below the ledge or above the ledge (which is easier but has a lot of rope drag).  The ledge is accessible by scrambling up a gully around to the left, or by climbing Thin to Win or Vegomatic.

content.description:
This is the far left bolt line that starts from the ledge above Thin To Win and left of Vegomatic. There is also a bolted anchor on this ledge.

The crux is pulling a little roof and getting established on the face at the first bolt. Depending on your endurance, it’s possible to clip the second bolt mid-roof pull and make it a little safer. After that it is gym bolted 5.6 jug climbing. You can move left out onto the arete at times, or stay direct on the face, just watch for a few friable holds. The climbing is good enough, but the position and view are what make this route worth doing, especially if the other Parking Lot climbs are taken.

It's possible to scramble up onto this ledge from way left (watch for briars and broken glass).

In the true spirit of Pilot Mountain, this once spicy trad lead has been neutered into a 10-bolt sport climb.

Nice little ledges and crimps lead you up the face, past a small seam and a flake to the ledge. Pull up onto the face above the ledge and head for the top. Consistent 5.7, with great moves and good exposure for Pilot.
content.protection: Sport- 10 bolts and anchors at the top.
content.location: Starts about 10 feet right of Vegomatic, at a small overhang.
